::: {.cell}

::: {.cell}

:::


The current valid map is identified by **Map code and version**: F2.10.web.mix v2.0.


> Major occurrences of subglacial lakes were mapped as point records from Wright and Siegert (2012), Bowler et al. (2019), Marteinsson et al. (2013) and Livingstone et al. (2016). Unmapped lakes are likely to occur within areas with permanent snow and ice cover and were mapped as minor occurrences based on permanent snow and ice from Dinerstein et al. (2017) and Tuanmu et al. (2014)..

::: {.cell}

:::


You can download and use this file from the following sources:

- Zenodo repository (bundle of maps) ([Includes GeoTIFF, GeoJSON and PNG versions in compressed file](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090419))

::: {.cell}

:::

This section provides information about the valid indicative distribution map for the ecosystem functional group [**F2.10 Subglacial lakes**](/efg-info/F2_10.qmd).


::: {.cell}

:::

## Available maps

These maps are considered current and valid indicative distribution maps for this ecosystem functional group.

- Web navigation (**code: F2.10.web.mix**, version v2.0) 
 - Indicative Map (**code: F2.10.IM.mix**, version v1.0) 

## Map files

You can download geospatial data for this map from the following sources:

F2.10.web.mix (v2.0){target="gisdata"}: [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/F2.10.web.mix_v2.0.tif) :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090419) :: [Earth Engine assets](projects/earthengine-legacy/assets/users/jrferrerparis/IUCN-GET/L3_IndMaps/)
F2.10.IM.mix (v1.0){target="gisdata"}: [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/F2.10.IM.mix_v1.0.tif) :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3958934)

Note that you need to login to some services like [mapbox](https://www.mapbox.com){target="links"} or [earthengine](https://earthengine.google.com){target="links"}, and in some cases you also need to request access to the files.
